name: High-Risk Pregnancy Interview Protocol
description: Specialized interview protocol for understanding experiences of women with high-risk pregnancies, including complications, specialized care, and psychosocial impacts.

questions.text: Can you tell me about yourself and your current pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: How far along are you?
Is this your first pregnancy?
What is your living situation like?

questions.text: When and how did you learn that your pregnancy was considered high-risk?
follow_up_prompts: What specific condition or factor makes it high-risk?
How did you feel when you received this news?
Did your healthcare provider explain things clearly?

questions.text: Can you tell me about the health conditions or complications you're experiencing?
follow_up_prompts: Are you managing chronic conditions like diabetes or hypertension?
Have there been pregnancy-specific complications?
How are these conditions being monitored?

questions.text: What kind of specialized prenatal care are you receiving?
follow_up_prompts: Are you seeing a maternal-fetal medicine specialist?
How often do you have appointments?
What types of monitoring or testing do you undergo?

questions.text: Can you describe your healthcare team and how they coordinate your care?
follow_up_prompts: How many different providers are you seeing?
Do they communicate well with each other?
Do you feel your care is well-coordinated?

questions.text: What kind of tests, scans, or monitoring have you had during this pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Have you had frequent ultrasounds or NSTs?
Do you monitor anything at home?
How do you receive and understand test results?

questions.text: What medications or treatments are you currently receiving for your high-risk condition?
follow_up_prompts: Have you had any hospitalizations?
Are you on bed rest or activity restrictions?
How are you managing side effects?

questions.text: Have you faced any challenges accessing the specialized care you need?
follow_up_prompts: How far do you travel for appointments?
Are there financial barriers?
Has insurance coverage been an issue?

questions.text: How has having a high-risk pregnancy affected you emotionally?
follow_up_prompts: Do you experience anxiety about your or the baby's health?
Have you received mental health support?
How are you coping with stress?

questions.text: How has your high-risk status affected your daily life and activities?
follow_up_prompts: Have you had to stop working?
Can you perform normal activities?
How has this affected your family?

questions.text: What kind of support do you have to help you through this high-risk pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Is your partner/family supportive?
Do you have help with other children or responsibilities?
Have you connected with others in similar situations?

questions.text: Do you feel you have adequate information about your condition and what to expect?
follow_up_prompts: Have your providers explained risks and outcomes?
What sources of information have been helpful?
What questions do you still have?

questions.text: What do you know about your delivery plan given your high-risk status?
follow_up_prompts: Will you deliver at a specialized hospital?
Is a cesarean section planned or likely?
What preparations have been made for potential complications?

questions.text: What have you learned about your baby's health and development?
follow_up_prompts: Are there concerns about the baby's growth or condition?
Have you been told about potential outcomes?
How are you preparing for your baby's arrival?

questions.text: Have you had previous pregnancies? How were they different from this one?
follow_up_prompts: Were previous pregnancies also high-risk?
What have you learned from past experiences?
How does this pregnancy compare?

metadata.author: Synthetic Gravidas Research Team
metadata.target_population: Women with high-risk pregnancies (chronic conditions, complications, advanced maternal age)
